Bash("C:\\Python314\\python.exe" -c "
from dotenv import load_dotenv; load_dotenv\(\)
import os
from supabase import create_client

url = os.environ[''SUPABASE_URL'']
key = os.environ[''SUPABASE_KEY'']
client = create_client\(url, key\)

statements = [
    ''ALTER TABLE extractions ADD COLUMN scraped_file_id UUID REFERENCES scraped_files\(id\)'',
    ''CREATE INDEX idx_extractions_scraped_file_id ON extractions\(scraped_file_id\)'',
    ''ALTER TABLE memo_extractions ADD COLUMN scraped_file_id UUID REFERENCES scraped_files\(id\)'',
    ''CREATE INDEX idx_memo_extractions_scraped_file_id ON memo_extractions\(scraped_file_id\)'',
]

# Supabase client doesn''t have raw SQL - need to use the management API or psql
# Let''s try using rpc if there''s a function, otherwise we need the DB connection string
# Check if there''s a DATABASE_URL or similar
db_url = os.environ.get\(''DATABASE_URL'', ''''\)
print\(f''DATABASE_URL set: {bool\(db_url\)}''\)

# Try service_role key for management API
service_key = os.environ.get\(''SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY'', ''''\)
print\(f''SERVICE_ROLE_KEY set: {bool\(service_key\)}''\)
print\(f''SUPABASE_URL: {url}''\)

# Extract project ref from URL
import re
match = re.search\(r''https://\([^.]+\)\\.supabase\\.co'', url\)
if match:
    print\(f''Project ref: {match.group\(1\)}''\)
")
